00049 /* ********************************************************************* */
00050 INT rpc_end_of_cycle(INT index, void *prpc_param[])
00051 {
00052   INT cycle_number = CINT(0);
00053   INT event_number = CINT(1);
00054 
00055   diag_print(2, "Cycle ended: RAM %d, event %d\n", cycle_number, event_number);
00056 
00057   // first send out "fake" zero-length events for those cycles
00058   // where we didn't participate
00059   for(INT fake_evnum=last_event_number+1; fake_evnum < event_number; 
00060       fake_evnum++) 
00061   {
00062     diag_print(2, "Sending fake catch-up event for %d\n", fake_evnum);
00063     char fake_event[sizeof(EVENT_HEADER) + sizeof(BANK_HEADER)];
00064     char *pevent = fake_event + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER);
00065 
00066     rpc_flush_event();
00067     bk_init32(pevent);
00068     bm_compose_event((EVENT_HEADER *) fake_event, 4, 0,
00069                      bk_size(pevent), fake_evnum);
00070     bm_send_event(equipment[0].buffer_handle, fake_event,
00071                     sizeof(fake_event), SYNC);
00072     bm_flush_cache(equipment[0].buffer_handle, SYNC);
00073   }
00074  
00075   event_ended = true;
00076   last_cycle = cycle_number;
00077   last_event_number = event_number;
00078 
00079   return SUCCESS;
00080 }

00088   INT event_number = CINT(1);
00089

00091

00093   // where we didn't participate

00095       fake_evnum++) 
00096   {
00097     diag_print(2, "Sending fake catch-up event for %d\n", fake_evnum);
00098     char fake_event[sizeof(EVENT_HEADER) + sizeof(BANK_HEADER)];
00099     char *pevent = fake_event + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER);
00100 
00101     rpc_flush_event();

00119 INT rpc_slave_init()
00120 {
00121   // register the RPC function that we provide
00122   rpc_register_functions(rpc_list_mucap, NULL);
00123   rpc_register_function(RPC_END_OF_CYCLE, rpc_end_of_cycle);
00124 
00125   return SUCCESS;
00126 }

00128 /* ********************************************************************* */
00129 INT rpc_slave_bor()
00130 {
00131   event_ended = FALSE;
00132   last_event_number = 0;
00133   sent_stop_request = -1;
00134   last_cycle = 0;
00135 
00136   // find the master crate
00137   int master_crate = -1;
00138   for(int i = 0; i < MAX_CRATES; i++) {
00139     if(odb_find_key("/Equipment/Crate %d", i) != NULL) {
00140       BOOL master = odb_get_bool("/Equipment/Crate %d/Settings/Master", i);
00141       if(master) master_crate = i;
00142     }
00143   }
00144 
00145   // maybe we're the master...in that case, disable slave function
00146   if(master_crate == crate_number) {
00147     enable_rpc_slave = FALSE;
00148     diag_print(1, "Disabling RPC slave function\n");
00149     return SUCCESS;
00150   } else {
00151     enable_rpc_slave = TRUE;
00152     diag_print(1, "Enabling RPC slave function\n");
00153   }
00154 
00155   // return error if unable to find the master crate
00156   if(master_crate < 0) {
00157     diag_print(0, "Unable to locate master crate\n");
00158     return FE_ERR_HW;
00159   }
00160   diag_print(1, "Found master crate %d\n", master_crate);
00161 
00162   // establish RPC connections to the master crate
00163   char master_crate_label[10];
00164   sprintf(master_crate_label, "Crate %d", master_crate);
00165 
00166   cm_connect_client(master_crate_label, &rpc_conn_master_crate);
00167   rpc_set_option(rpc_conn_master_crate, RPC_OTRANSPORT, RPC_FTCP);
00168   rpc_set_option(rpc_conn_master_crate, RPC_NODELAY, TRUE);
00169 
00170   send_ready_for_cycle();
00171 
00172   return SUCCESS;
00173 }
00174 
00175 /* ********************************************************************* */
00176 INT rpc_slave_eor()
00177 {
00178   if(enable_rpc_slave) {
00179     cm_disconnect_client(rpc_conn_master_crate, 0);
00180   }
00181   return SUCCESS;
00182 }

00184 /* ********************************************************************* */
00185 INT rpc_slave_poll_live()
00186 {
00187   if(!enable_rpc_slave) {
00188     return SUCCESS;
00189   }
00190 
00191   // Yield to receive any pending RPCs
00192   cm_yield(0);
00193 
00194   // Have we received an end-of-event notice?
00195   if(event_ended) {
00196     event_ended = FALSE;
00197     diag_print(2, "event ended\n");
00198     return FE_END_BLOCK;
00199   } else {
00200     return SUCCESS;
00201   }
00202 }
00203 
00204 /* ********************************************************************* */
00205 INT rpc_slave_poll_dead()
00206 {
00207   if(!enable_rpc_slave) {
00208     return SUCCESS;
00209   }
00210 
00211   return FE_NEED_START;
00212 }
00213 
00214 /* ********************************************************************* */
00215 INT rpc_slave_stop_block()
00216 {
00217   if(!enable_rpc_slave) {
00218     return SUCCESS;
00219   }
00220 
00221   int event_number = last_event_number + 1;
00222 
00223   // Send a request to the master crate for the block to end.
00224   if(sent_stop_request < event_number) {
00225     rpc_client_call(rpc_conn_master_crate, RPC_REQUEST_STOP, crate_number, 
00226       event_number);
00227     sent_stop_request = event_number;
00228   }
00229 
00230   return SUCCESS;
00231 }

00258 /* ********************************************************************* */
00259 INT send_ready_for_cycle()
00260 {
00261 >>>>>>> 1.4
00262   // Send "ready to go"
00263   struct timeval tv1, tv2;
00264   gettimeofday(&tv1, NULL);
00265   rpc_client_call(rpc_conn_master_crate, RPC_READY_FOR_CYCLE, crate_number, 0); 
00266   gettimeofday(&tv2, NULL);
00267 
00268   diag_print(2, "Waited %f microseconds for RPC_READY_FOR_CYCLE.\n",
00269     (tv2.tv_sec-tv1.tv_sec)*1e6 + (tv2.tv_usec-tv1.tv_usec));
00270    
00271   return SUCCESS;
00272 }
